## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
```{r}
#Load the here package

library(tidyverse)
library(here)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
#Read in biomass data
alg_biomass <- read_csv(here("data", "raw", "alg_biomass.csv"))
```
```{r}
subset_data <- alg_biomass %>% 
  select("adjAshFreeDryMass", "siteID", "collectDate2")
```

```{r}
subset_data%>%
  write_csv(here("data", "processed", "alg_biomass.csv"))
```

```{r}
subset_data <- na.omit(subset_data) %>%
mutate(collectDate2 = as_date(collectDate)) %>%
select(-collectDate)

```

```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, here, palmerpenguins, cowplot, viridis)
```


```{r}
ggplot(data = subset_data ,
       aes(x = adjAshFreeDryMass))  +
  geom_histogram() 
```
```{r}
ggplot(data = subset_data, 
       mapping = aes(x = siteID,
                     y = adjAshFreeDryMass)) + 
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(x = "Site", 
       y = "adjAshFreeDryMass (g/L") +
  #scale_y_continuous(limits = c(20, 60),
                     #breaks = seq(20, 60, 10)) +
  theme_bw()

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
 alg_biomass_means<- alg_biomass %>% 
  mutate(collectDate = as_date(collectDate2)) %>% 
  mutate(collectMonth = month(collectDate2), collectYear = year(collectDate2)) %>% 
 group_by(siteID, collectYear, collectMonth) %>% 
  summarise(mean_adjAshFreeDryMass = mean(adjAshFreeDryMass)) %>%
  write_csv(here("data", "processed", "alg_biomass_means.csv"))
```
